settings.title: OY TO THE WORLD ORIGIN STORY
settings.text: A Story About Hanukkah Running Sunglasses

settings.title: A GUIDE TO YIDDISH SLANG BY CARL THE FLAMINGO
settings.text:
Chutzpah: extreme self-confidence or audacity. (It took real chutzpah for my idiot cousin, Teddy the Turkey, to ask me to write this origin story for him.)

Klutz: a clumsy, awkward, or foolish person. (Teddy the Turkey is such a f***ing klutz he tripped and got his head stuck in the toilet. Which is why he asked me to write this origin story for him.)

Kvell: feel happy and proud. (Teddy the Turkey’s parents won’t be kvellin after I tell them he tripped and got his head stuck in the toilet.)

Mensch: a person of integrity and honor. (“Teddy the Turkey is a real mensch,” said no one, ever. )

Meshuggeneh: senseless; crazy (You must be meshuggeneh if you believe that origin story about how Teddy the Turkey and I met. You really think he hit me in the head with a rolling pan and I grew a magic wattle, which taught me a valuable lesson? Get the f*** out of here.)

Nosh: eat food enthusiastically or greedily. (Teddy the Turkey’s so stupid if he fell asleep in a sauna he’d nosh on himself.)

Oy vey: An expression of woe. (As in: “Oy vey, I have to write this origin story!” Look, these Oy! To The World Hanukkah-themed sunglasses are dope af. But I ALREADY wrote an origin story for our Hanukkah sunnies last year (We Had Lights First). Why do I have to do it AGAIN this year?! IT’S NOT FAIR!!!! There are MUCH better things I could be doing right now. Like drinking.”.

Plotz: collapse or be beside oneself with frustration or annoyance (I am so tired of writing this f***ing origin story I could plotz.)

Putz: a stupid or worthless person; or, slang for a penis (Did you hear that hopeless tabaholic Teddy the Turkey got his head stuck in the toilet? What a putz. Speaking of putzes: did you know male turkeys don’t have penises?!?! Instead, they have cloaca, like the female turkeys! HAHAHAHAHA--wait. Male flamingos don’t have penises either. DAMNIT.)

Schlep: haul or carry (something heavy or awkward) (Some goodr employees got Teddy the Turkey’s head out of the toilet. He’s feeling weak, so they’re schlepping him to a couch. They BETTER put towels down. Toilet water’s nasty.)

Schmuck: a foolish or contemptible person; or, slang for a penis (Yeah, I don’t have a schmuck, but at least I’m not a schmuck.)

Spiel: a long or fast speech or story, primarily intended as a means for persuasion (This spiel is over. Blah blah blah, buy Oy! To The World sunglasses.)

settings.title: MORE FESTIVE READS FOR YOU FESTIVE FLAMINGOS
